subject: Alpine Skiing
lead_paragraph: Bode Miller was fined by the International Ski Federation for skipping the public bib draw for Sunday’s World Cup downhill race so he would receive a later start position and possibly better light on the Stelvio course in Bormio, Italy. Miller missed Saturday’s draw and was fined $933 by the federation, event organizers said. Top racers like Miller are usually drawn to start from 15th to 25th, but he will be the 46th starter.
